data.event: It was incorporated in 1922, and is nicknamed The City By the Sea (as seen in Latin on its official seal).

event.title: 2012, Jack Schnirman is the city manager, a position appointed

data.event: As of 2012, Jack Schnirman is the city manager, a position appointed by the City Council.

event.title: sold the area to English colonists in 1643

data.event: Long Beach's first inhabitants were the Algonquian-speaking Rockaway Indians, who sold the area to English colonists in 1643.

event.title: lived there year-round for more than two centuries

data.event: While the barrier island was used by baymen and farmers for fishing and harvesting salt hay, no one lived there year-round for more than two centuries.
In 1849 Congress established a lifesaving station.

event.title: A dozen years before, 62 people died

data.event: A dozen years before, 62 people died when the barque Mexico, carrying Irish immigrants to New York, ran ashore on New Year's Day.

event.title: ran ashore on New Year's Day

data.event: A dozen years before, 62 people died when the barque Mexico, carrying Irish immigrants to New York, ran ashore on New Year's Day.
